member.name: T:Sandbox.SkipHotloadAttribute
member.summary: Skip processing a specific field, or any fields in a type marked by this attribute. Field processing will still occur if a type marked by this attribute was defined in a swapped assembly.
member.remarks: This is nice for speeding up hotloading, particularly when used on types with lots of fields, or on fields that are the only path to large networks of objects that all don't need replacing during the hotload.

member.name: T:Sandbox.SuppressNullKeyWarningAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a member with or type, don't warn if the key of an item becomes null during a hotload because a type is removed. You should only use this attribute if you're sure that it's safe to quietly remove entries.

member.summary: The _start. Index of the first element in buffer.

member.summary: The _end. Index after the last element in the buffer.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1._size
member.summary: The _size. Buffer size.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.#ctor(System.Int32,`0[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Items to fill buffer with. Items length must be less than capacity. Suggestion: use Skip(x).Take(y).ToArray() to build this argument from any enumerable.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.Capacity
member.summary: Maximum capacity of the buffer. Elements pushed into the buffer after maximum capacity is reached (IsFull = true), will remove an element.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.IsFull
member.summary: Boolean indicating if Circular is at full capacity. Adding more elements when the buffer is full will cause elements to be removed from the other end of the buffer.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.IsEmpty
member.summary: True if has no elements.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.Size
member.summary: Current buffer size (the number of elements that the buffer has).

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.Front
member.summary: Element at the front of the buffer - this[0].
member.returns: The value of the element of type T at the front of the buffer.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.Back
member.summary: Element at the back of the buffer - this[Size - 1].
member.returns: The value of the element of type T at the back of the buffer.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Index access to elements in buffer. Index does not loop around like when adding elements, valid interval is [0;Size[
member.exception: Thrown when index is outside of [; Size[ interval.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.PushBack(`0)
member.summary:
Pushes a new element to the back of the buffer. Back()/this[Size-1] will now return this element.
When the buffer is full, the element at Front()/this[0] will be popped to allow for this new element to fit.
member.param: Item to push to the back of the buffer

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.PushFront(`0)
member.summary:
Pushes a new element to the front of the buffer. Front()/this[0] will now return this element.
When the buffer is full, the element at Back()/this[Size-1] will be popped to allow for this new element to fit.
member.param: Item to push to the front of the buffer

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.PopBack
member.summary: Removes the element at the back of the buffer. Decreasing the Buffer size by 1.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.PopFront
member.summary: Removes the element at the front of the buffer. Decreasing the Buffer size by 1.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of the array. Size = 0, Capacity is unchanged.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.ToArray
member.summary: Copies the buffer contents to an array, according to the logical contents of the buffer (i.e. independent of the internal order/contents)
member.returns: A new array with a copy of the buffer contents.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.ToArraySegments
member.summary:
Get the contents of the buffer as 2 ArraySegments. Respects the logical contents of the buffer, where each segment and items in each segment are ordered according to insertion.
Fast: does not copy the array elements. Useful for methods like Send(IList<ArraySegment<Byte>>).
Segments may be empty.
member.returns: An IList with 2 segments corresponding to the buffer content.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through this buffer.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate this collection.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.Increment(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Increments the provided index variable by one, wrapping around if necessary.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.Decrement(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Decrements the provided index variable by one, wrapping around if necessary.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Utility.CircularBuffer`1.InternalIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the index in the argument to an index in _buffer

member.name: M:Vector3.ProjectOnNormal(Vector3@)
member.summary:
Projects this vector onto another vector.
Basically extends the given normal/unit vector to be as long as necessary to make a right triangle (a triangle which has a 90 degree corner) between (0,0,0), this vector and the projected vector.

member.name: M:Vector3.SubtractDirection(Vector3@,System.Single)
member.summary: Given a vector like 1,1,1 and direction 1,0,0, will return 0,1,1. This is useful for velocity collision type events, where you want to cancel out velocity based on a normal. For this to work properly, direction should be a normal, but you can scale how much you want to subtract by scaling the direction. Ie, passing in a direction with a length of 0.5 will remove half the direction.

member.name: M:Vector3.TryParse(System.String,System.IFormatProvider,Vector3@)
member.summary:
Given a string, try to convert this into a vector. Example input formats that work would be "1,1,1", "1;1;1", "[1 1 1]".
This handles a bunch of different separators ( ' ', ',', ';', '\n', '\r' ).
It also trims surrounding characters ('[', ']', ' ', '\n', '\r', '\t', '"').

member.name: M:Vector3.TcbSpline(Vector3@,Vector3@,Vector3@,Vector3@,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates an interpolated point using the Kochanek-Bartels spline (TCB spline).
member.param: Tension parameter which affects the sharpness at the control point. Positive values make the curve tighter, negative values make it rounder.
Continuity parameter which affects the continuity between segments. Positive values create smoother transitions, negative values can create corners.
Bias parameter which affects the direction of the curve as it passes through the control point. Positive values bias the curve towards the next point, negative values towards the previous.
The interpolation parameter between 0 and 1, where 0 is the start of the segment and 1 is the end.
member.returns: The interpolated point on the curve.

member.summary: Modelled on AsyncLocal. Allows making variables that are different depending on the context, which is either game or menu.
